elements.title: Seated Woman with Bent Knees (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Egon Schiele disrupted the dichotomy between beauty and ugliness in his Seated Woman with Bent Knees (pictured)?

elements.title: Church of the Immaculate Conception (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Church of the Immaculate Conception was rededicated as a shrine in 1954, 100 years after the dogma of the Immaculate Conception was defined?

elements.title: Markus Becker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Markus Becker, who earned awards for his recording of the complete piano works by Max Reger, also recorded jazz?

elements.title: Open Syllabus Project (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to the Open Syllabus Project, the most widely taught novel in college courses is Frankenstein?

elements.title: César Mascetti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that César Mascetti was reportedly the first Argentine journalist to interview a member of the Beatles when he met a naked George Harrison on a Rio de Janeiro beach?

elements.title: IBM EduQuest (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that IBM EduQuest equipped the floppy drives in their computer systems with a dust shield to prevent the intrusion of dirt and chalk dust?

elements.title: an ancient Chinese medical encyclopaedia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an ancient Chinese medical encyclopaedia recommends qigong as a cure for most diseases?

elements.title: a grey poplar in Amsterdam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a grey poplar in Amsterdam is "the tree that saw it all"?
